intro: Silaum alpestre, commonly known as alpine silaum, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a slightly aromatic scent. Silaum alpestre is known for its resilience to harsh climates and is often found in high-altitude meadows.
